intro: Psychotria simplex, commonly known as the "small psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, elliptic leaves that are often glossy in appearance. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and feature a distinctive white or pale blue coloration. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various traditional uses attributed to its leaves and flowers.
